newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: No timed local calls - Australia's Telstra.
newsitem.headline: No timed local calls - Australia's Telstra.

text.p: Australia's state-owned telecommunications firm Telstra Corp said on Tuesday it would not introduce compulsory timed local telephone calls for data services.
"Under...legislation, residential customers are guaranteed access to untimed local calls for both voice and data," Telstra Internet manager John Rolland said in a statement.
In Australia, telephone calls within a defined local area are charged at a single set rate, regardless of how long they last.
